section.title: Herbed Gravy
section.content:
Here's a recipe for classic turkey gravy with fresh herbs:

Classic Turkey Gravy with Fresh Herbs

Ingredients:
- Pan drippings from roasted turkey
- 4 cups turkey or chicken stock
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 4 tablespoons butter
- 2 tablespoons fresh thyme leaves
- 2 tablespoons fresh sage, finely chopped
- 1 tablespoon fresh rosemary, finely chopped
- Salt and black pepper to taste

Instructions:
1. After roasting turkey, remove it from roasting pan, leaving drippings

2. Place roasting pan on stovetop over medium heat
- Scrape up browned bits from bottom of pan

3. Melt butter in the pan with drippings
- Add flour and whisk to make a roux
- Cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring constantly

4. Gradually add stock while whisking constantly
- Continue whisking until smooth and lump-free
- Simmer until thickened, about 5-10 minutes

5. Add fresh herbs
- Season with salt and pepper to taste
- Simmer for additional 2-3 minutes

6. Strain gravy through fine-mesh sieve if desired
- Serve hot

Tips:
- For extra smoothness, strain before adding herbs
- Can be made ahead and reheated
- Add more stock if gravy becomes too thick

Enjoy your homemade herb-infused turkey gravy!
